column5: The one picture looks like Eagle chum.... I mean "Nice Musky".
My boat got lucky at erie this spring, 28, 28, 29, 29 1/4, 29 1/2, & 30 1/2. all in the same day, too bad that will never happen again for as long as I live! But I'll sure try hard!!
32 1/2" Tobin Lake
My biggest this year was 30" My brother on the same trip caught a 32 1/2" pig!I don't know how much his fish weighed but he is 270 lbs and this fish made him look little!FC

Got a 31 3/4 incher last week that went 14.47 pounds, not the longest but is the heaviest this year so far. Still have a few weeks to break the 15 pound mark. I'm hoping to do it while my buddy Jamie is in the boat with me next week.
If I remember it was just under 31", one of about six we caught that morning all in the 28" to 31" range.

Just back from Anjigaming lake in the Chapleau Game Preserve.My largest was 281/2", my buddy got one a hair over 30". I lost one even larger, it was a real heartbreaker.Many more fish 23-26", it was an outstanding trip.Most fish caught jigging deep water with 5/8oz heads and either oversized grubs or 5" Gulp minnows.
Our group had a 26 incher and a 25.5 in. as the biggest walleyes in the boat. Mine was 17 in. That's the way it goes eh!!
Juls is good but check out jim lyon's walleye on YouTube..... http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8i6r7iMTGS8

biggest i could must was a 28.75 incher outta the upper chukuni river in late june was solid but didnt weigh her caught a few in the 24 to 26 inch range but far n few between had a good yr and it aint over just yet lol
Got my first Lac Seul straight flush a couple of weeks ago: 25,26,27,28,29 in two days on the water. Counting down until next year.

Been fishing Lake Erie for years and never broke the seven pound mark until this year. Got a 29.5" and a 28.5" on back to back cast drifting throwing a Erie Dearie, both came on the swing. My biggest in Ontario this year was a 26" caught on a jig and twister tail. I'm happy
53 Inch.Oops,WRONG KIND!
29 inch.June 2012

30.5", caught opening week in Sawmill Bay. Caught off the clay banks in 4 foot of water on a yellow lindy rig with a leech. We were anchored and I was casting, biggest Walleye our group has caught in 16yrs. My first over 30" too! Couldn't stop shaking after I got her in the boat. If I would have caught her a week or two ago, would have been a monster! CPR

Woooo hoooo!!!!Caught a 30" walleye on Lotw on Oct 8th!!!!! It was a nasty day out there but so rewarding rained all day, temps were just above freezing & up to a foot of snow in the ditches on the way to the lake...... Got to test the new Guidewear jacket for 8 hrs in steady rain/drizzle & it performs just as advertised
Three 29" caught on Dogtooth. Red spinner and a minnow.

Trashed my lower unit at a lake and decided since I was on vacation I'd walk the banks of the James River in Jamestown ND. Was only 2-3' deep under the bridge I was at in a park but I guess that's where the 29"s hang out.
Mike. I know of Aldous Bay. We have fished it several times..................another great spot on Lac seul.
Hi Mike, I caught a 27.5 inch walleye about 100 yards from the boat dock in Black Bay on Lac Seul.
I haven't caught any monsters this season, a lot from 22-25. Biggest so far is 26.5". Last year was much better, three 28's, a bunch of 27's, and a pile of 26's. There's always next year!!
Angler 1860 Quote :"There's Always next year" Well One year your gonna be wrong about that. So go hard or go hard or get hard going hard.......aghhhh i lost it
14.45 lbs caught on rig and leech.
Nice work. How long was it Luke?
It was 31 inches . Was a pretty cool looking pickerel lol. Was one fat fish.
The largest was the first one....12.7 The second and third one pictured were both 11.9's It's Lake Erie....what can I say? Juls

Time to hear about your biggest Walleye in 2012. Mine was 28" this year and was caught in June on Lac Seul at a place called Aldous Bay. Caught on a Sirmanski Glitter Jig (Gold 3/16oz) and a minnow. Mike Kansas
Gosh...there were sooo many.
Gosh...there were soooo many.
No huge ones for me, but plenty of nice pike. Maybe I'm not a fit for this forum. Have been in NW Ontario only 12 days so far, but looking at 9 or 16 more days beginning in less than a week, I hope.
33 inches and a half dozen around 32 1/2. 33 came on a jig and the other ones came on cranks, spinners and riggin leeches.
Uncle!
I hate you..............j/k..good job..
34.25" on a jig and crawler 31 inch on a fly-rod maybe a dozen 31s and 32s
28.25" early spring on LOTW Ontario, 27" last Saturday on LOTW as well.....now looking for at least a 30"

Ya about 35 inches ,18 pounds But my camera was left at home and i would have love a picture of that 37 inch 20 pound eye. And some one stole the tape measure right out of my boat when i went to the restroom I couldn't believe it. I finally catch one at the 39 inch mark and it was gone So i just eye balled it and it was the nicest 41 inch walleye i ever caught It had nicer marking than the 43 incher from last year from last year i caught up in the Fraser river in the Rockies I tell ya those ocean run walleye's are some tough
